articles.author: Prasun Chakraborty
articles.description:
Welcome to the next exciting step in "JavaScript Deep Dive"! Previously, we mastered managing tasks with arrays and objects. Now, let's introduce user interactions through functions and event listeners, enabling dynamic task addition directly through user input. But to do that we need to learn couple of interesting javascript concepts.
Functions are reusable blocks of code designed to perform specific tasks. They help reduce repetition and improve readability by breaking complex operations into steps, also making code easier to debug and maintain.
Function Declaration:
These are the most common type of functions. They are defined using the function keyword, followed by the function name, parameters, and the function body.




function addTask(taskName) {
  if (!taskName) return; // Early eâ€¦
articles.title: JavaScript Interaction: Adding Tasks with Functions and Events

articles.author: Aditya Pratap Bhuyan
articles.description:
Real-time systems are those that must adhere to strict timing constraints, ensuring tasks complete their operations within predetermined deadlines. In domains such as automotive control, industrial automation, robotics, and aerospace, microcontrollers often operate under these real-time requirements. When engineers design software for these constrained environments, many issues surface that do not commonly arise in desktop-level or cloud-computing applications. One particularly critical challenge revolves around dynamic memory allocation.  
Dynamic memory allocation involves requesting memory from a central resource (the heap) at runtime, rather than at compile time. In a desktop environment, this process might be handled by a sophisticated operating system or runtime library with mechanisâ€¦
articles.title: Dynamic Memory Allocation in Real-Time Microcontroller Systems: Challenges, Implications, and Language Choices

articles.author: Marty Roque
articles.description:
State management in React has evolved dramatically. Gone are the days when Redux was your only choice for complex applications. Today's atomic state management libraries offer fine-grained reactivity, minimal boilerplate, and better performance. But which one should you choose?
Traditional state management forces entire components to re-render when any part of the state changes. Atomic state management flips this approach - only components subscribed to specific pieces of state update when those pieces change.
This granular approach offers several key benefits:
Performance: Eliminates unnecessary re-renders
Simplicity: No complex provider trees or reducer boilerplate
Scalability: Independent state atoms that don't interfere with each other
Developer Experience: Intuitive APIs that feel natâ€¦
articles.title: Atomic State Management: Why Nucleux Stands Out from Jotai and Zustand

articles.description:
Kubernetes v1.33 has finally brought Image Volume to Î² status! (â€»disabled by default)
read-only volumes - isn't this revolutionary?
Say goodbye to the old way of "cramming everything into one container", and hello to:
Application code
Runtime
Libraries
...all split into separate images and mounted independently!
This is especially powerful for scripting language users (Node.js/Python/etc.)!
node:22.15.1.
The beauty of Image Volume is creating ultra-lightweight OCI images containing only code and config files.
index.js â€“ The App




const http = require('http');
http.createServer((_, res) => res.end('Hello from OCI volume!\n'))
    .listen(process.env.PORT || 80);

A simple HTTP server in Node.js that returns "Hello from OCI volume!"
Dockerfile â€“ The Shocking "FROM scratch"




FROM scratchâ€¦

articles.author: Fadil Natakusumah
articles.description:
ğŸŒ Easy i18n in React with Tolgee


If you're building a React app and want to support multiple languages, using a localization library like Tolgee can make your life much easier. In this post, Iâ€™ll walk you through how to add Tolgee to a React project using the App Router (Next.js 13+), support multiple languages, and even set up a language switcher.


  
  
  ğŸ”§ What is Tolgee?


Tolgee is a modern i18n (internationalization) tool for web apps. It supports in-context translation, works well with TypeScript, and integrates nicely with React. Itâ€™s like i18next, but a bit easier to set up and manageâ€”especially with its cloud UI.


  
  
  ğŸ› ï¸ Getting Started


Letâ€™s start by installing the required packages.
npm install @tolgee/react tolgee

Create a file called tolgee.ts in your lib folderâ€¦
articles.title: i18n With Tolgee

articles.author: Aayush Yadav
articles.description:
In this project, I built a basic static file server using Node.js. The server listens on port 3000 and serves HTML, CSS, JS, and PNG files from the project directory. It uses Node's built-in http, fs, and path modules to handle requests and serve files with the correct MIME types. If a requested file is not found, the server responds with a custom 404 message.
This project is a great starting point for anyone looking to understand how to serve static files with Node.js without any external frameworks. The main purpose of this project is to teach and to demonstrate the capabilities of nodeJS.
Check out the code on GitHub:
https://github.com/aayush130405/Node-static-server.git
articles.title: Simple Node.js Static File Server

articles.author: Dat One Dev
articles.description:
Introduction


I was drinking lassi.
Wikipedia.
Whatever, I was drinking lassi and scrolling through YouTube, when I stumbled upon this video by Mr.PiwPiew.
After completing the video, I looked through the comment section, and then I came here to write this blog.
The top comment was made by @NFvidoJagg2. It was
HTML is not a programming language, it's an XML based markup language used to build webpages.
I can't describe how shocked I was at that time. All the time I didn't knew HTML isn't a programming language
Now you can call me dumb, but in the end I found out that it's not a programming language and now I am here to help those who still consider it as a programming language.
First, if you already knew the full form of HTML, I am 60% sure you also know it's not a programming language, bâ€¦
articles.title: Is HTML not a Programming Language?

articles.author: Engineered AI
articles.description:
AI was supposed to make development easier.
What weâ€™re left with is half-understood code, test coverage duct-taped together, and developers trusting output they didnâ€™t write, donâ€™t own, and canâ€™t fully explain.
So now weâ€™re here:
Hereâ€™s how we got hereâ€”and what nobodyâ€™s saying out loud.
ğŸ§  Prompt Engineering Isnâ€™t Engineering
Prompt engineering sounds smartâ€”until you realize itâ€™s just creative Googling with better grammar.
We wrote about why the term â€œengineeringâ€ doesnâ€™t belong here. Because if your process breaks when phrasing changes, itâ€™s not engineering. Itâ€™s trial-and-error with a marketing spin.
ğŸ”€ AI vs Traditional Coding Isnâ€™t the Right Debate
People love debating whether AI will replace traditional coders.
Traditional coding builds muscle memory. AI coding builds dependency.
ğŸ§¨ Weâ€™re Creating Technical Debt Faster Than Ever
The more you rely on AI, the less you review what it does.
This isnâ€™t a rantâ€”itâ€™s a warning.
By the time youâ€™re fixing it, the damage is already deployed.
ğŸ§Ÿâ€â™‚ï¸ And Now Itâ€™s Writing SEO Content Too...
Itâ€™s not just code. AI is now pumping out articles that say nothingâ€”but rank anyway.
And just like bad code, bad content piles up until the signal gets buried.
AIâ€™s not the problem.
Weâ€™ll keep debugging, rewriting, and firefighting until we treat AI as a tool, not a shortcut.
You just swapped one problem for another.
ğŸ” This post was reframed from EngineeredAI.net â€”
â˜•ï¸ Buy Me a Coffee if this saved you from another AI-generated mess. I run this blog solo. No sponsors. No clickbait. Just real tests, real bugs, and real dev logic.
articles.title: AI Is Writing the Codeâ€”So Why Are We Still Debugging Everything by Hand?

articles.author: Newsdesk
